abstract: Cheap credit may have disappeared, the equity markets may be in the dumps, and the deal graveyard may be littered with failed buyouts, but don’t call it crisis. At least not if you’re speaking with Louis V. Gerstner Jr., chairman of the Carlyle Group, one of the world’s largest private equity firms.
